comment: Grassy taste with grain spirit smell
Very cheap grainy taste some grass banana and sugar.
Japanese whisky never ceases to impress me. This one is very mild, and has an almost wine-like aroma. Mellow and sweet.
Honey, green apple, and cherry blossom nose; honey, apple, and young mizunara oak; a significant burn, medium texture; spiced apple finish
Young,alcaholic, grain spirit is dominant. Easy to drink and short finish. Color added? I think...yes.
Good amount of vanilla with some fruit elements...maybe pear? Smells is not the best
Very drinkable and smooth. No off notes, but no distinguishing flavors, either.

Solid, smooth, young whisky-blend for a reasonable price. Nothing that will blow your socks off but an excellent bargain for a Japanese import, of whom are extremely maticulous and attent to detail. Presentation is elegant and makes it feel like youre drinking something much more expensive. Moderate to highly recommended depending on your persuasion to cheaper blends

Very flat, alcoholic, with cereal flavors. Light pear nose, empty and smooth finish
No years, 40% light golden colour. Nose is light, earthy, honey, some flowers, and toffee. In mouth cedar, spices, coconut, caramel. Light short end.
